thread.title: Carly Fiorina on Virginia Senate run: 'I'm certainly looking at that opportunity' - CNNPolitics.com
thread.title_full: Carly Fiorina on Virginia Senate run: 'I'm certainly looking at that opportunity' - CNNPolitics.com

author: Andrew Kaczynski
title: Carly Fiorina on Virginia Senate run: 'I'm certainly looking at that opportunity' - CNNPolitics.com
text:
Carly Fiorina on Virginia Senate run: 'I'm certainly looking at that opportunity' By Andrew Kaczynski, CNN Updated 0220 GMT (1020 HKT) February 8, 2017 
Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds. Story highlights "Look, I'm certainly looking at that opportunity," Fiorina said. She added: "It's a little early to be making that decision." (CNN) Former Republican presidential candidate Carly Fiorina on Monday told a local Virginia radio show that she's considering running for the U.S. Senate seat in Virginia in 2018. Asked on the John Fredericks Show if she would run for Senate, Fiorina said, "Well, I don't know yet, John. Sorry, I'm not gonna make a big announcement on your show." "Look, I'm certainly looking at that opportunity," she added. "It's a little early to be making that decision, we're two weeks into a new administration." Fiorina's name has been floated , according to a report in Politico, as one of the leading contenders to challenge incumbent Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine in the state. Her comments this week are the latest indication she's seriously considering a run. She added it would be "very, very tough race" against Kaine. Read More Earlier in the interview, Fredericks said he was convinced Fiorina would run in 2018, noting her presence at many local events around the state. "Who knows what the future will bring," she responded, "but I look forward to continuing to talk to the people of the Commonwealth of Virginia about things that we agree on, things that we may not yet know we agree on -- most people are pragmatic, most people have a lot of common sense." Sections
